content:
For https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/12614, we should change the color of alert words in night mode. I would love some feedback from anyone on this change. I've done something just like @Steve Howell suggested in this https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/14248 but am not sure on the exact value of the color.
image.png
Screenshot-from-2020-03-21-01-12-58.png
Have we ever considered just underlining alert words?

Vaibhav Raj Singh actually suggested an idea for alert words and I think we could consider this.
image.png

if I have to select a color that can relate to alert, I will probably select red/orange color
How about just changing the alert word color to something like that rather than highlighting with bg-color?

Abhishek B Chakravarthi said:

Vaibhav Raj Singh actually suggested an idea for alert words and I think we could consider this.
image.png

yeah we can try some different color with the same strategy

Siddharth said:

Abhishek B Chakravarthi said:

Vaibhav Raj Singh actually suggested an idea for alert words and I think we could consider this.
image.png

yeah we can try some different color with the same strategy

That's also a good idea.
@Steve Howell I've gone ahead and made a commit for the yellow color. Check it out whenever you can.

@Abhishek B Chakravarthi For quick feedback, it's helpful to repost the links: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/14248#issuecomment-601913492

I'm not a great judge of color, but I think we want something brighter. There's a shade of green called "puke green" that we don't want to get too close to. :slight_smile:
Thanks! I'll work on it.

I think you might wanna explore approaches other than the background color one. as it's a purely visual change, try out multiple variations, post their SS over here and everyone can give in their suggestions.

I'll reiterate that night-mode doesn't have to exactly mirror what day-mode does here. We're not even 100% wedded to the day-mode implementation for day-mode, but in day-mode, having a background color is sort of a natural way to make a word stand out. In night mode, I can see the argument that changing the foreground color is actually more likely to stand out to a user (plus be more aesthetically pleasing). So I agree with the suggestion from @Vaibhav Raj Singh to just post a couple tiny screenshots here with various approaches.
Sure. I also feel that text color will work well.
I'm also re-posting the original issue for convenience: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/12614 As the issue title states, we want to be particularly helpful to folks with color-blindness.

Vaibhav Raj Singh actually suggested an idea for alert words and I think we could consider this.
image.png

As for the colour I used in this example, it wasn't arbitrary. I usually use color safe contrast for picking out what colors go best with each other. The site I mentioned sorts colors according to % of visibility.
Also use RGBlind chrome extension for making it color blind friendly.

zulip.gif
Came up with some. I personally like the 1st one.
@Vaibhav Raj Singh ColorSafe is damn good. Thanks for pointing it out.
I personally like the green one
Which one? There's a slightly bluish green first and full green later on.
the fully green one...although there is a very subtle difference between two
@Steve Howell Your opinion?
I think I still like this the best: https://chat.zulip.org/user_uploads/2/ff/WD7VyMcQxfHhsX0JSEmO1MNy/image.png
The above came from @Vaibhav Raj Singh using the color matching site.
That is the bluish green one. Should I go ahead with it?
Yep!
Getting Josh Mandel's opinion would be great here.
maybe just ping on the issue tracker? (this is a report from several months ago soo...)
Pinged him on the issue. Should I wait for his reply to make the commit?
No, don't bother waiting.
@Steve Howell Made the commit https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/14248.

https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/12614 Josh Mandel suggests a background highlight. He also said that as long as it is clearly visible, we shouldn't worry about it blending with the UI. Any suggestions on the background color? @Steve Howell Is this fine?
Screenshot-from-2020-03-21-21-23-46.png
That red background feels too much like "ERROR!" to me, but I don't have a strong opinion here. I'm not the final decision maker here.
Could you let me know who decides on this?

Tim Abbott makes the final decision. It may be a while till he gets to this due to various circumstances.

I think you can make it a little easier for him to make a quick decision by doing the following:

  • make your screenshots more focused--no need to show so much of the left sidebar, for example
  • pick the three options you like the best (weighing in some of the feedback from others, as needed)
  • give a clear label for each option

You can do that either here or on the PR.

@Tim Abbott Help us decide on the default color for alert words in night mode.
ISSUE LINK :- https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/12614
PR LINK :- https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/14248

  1. Background Color - Mobile Solution
    image.png
    One option is to approach this the same way it was handled with mobile. Josh Mandel suggested that as long as visibility is achieved, blending in with the UI is not a priority and that we should stick with background highlighting.

  2. Font color and weight
    image.png
    When posted in the chat, a lot of people liked this but Josh Mandel felt that it doesn't stand out as much as background highlighting.

  3. Font weight and Background color Screenshot-from-2020-03-21-22-01-59.png
    Maybe red isn't the best color but we can make the font bolder and have a different background color.

Would love to have your opinion on this? Would like to know what format and what color to use. Just an idea on the type of color would also be good.

I think foreground color may not be ideal in that we might in the future add a markdown feature allowing one to set the foreground color of text, so I'd prefer something more distinctive than colored text. I wonder if there's something that looks like the background color but is a bit more styled (E.g. doing rounded corners on the color region, or something); the pure background color has a bit of a problem with looking similar to the search highlighting (just with a different color), which may not be desired. I agree we don't want red as the background color.
@Tim Abbott Screencast-from-Sunday-22-March-2020-114823-IST.webm
Sorry, didn't know how to embed it to the chat.
I feel this should be good. You can choose the color and if we need a background or foreground color.

Abhishek B Chakravarthi said:

Tim Abbott Screencast-from-Sunday-22-March-2020-114823-IST.webm

@Steve Howell your opinion on this?

alert.gif

@Tim Abbott I made a GIF. Should I go ahead with a blinking approach? Background and foreground color is up to you.
No blinking, please.
Any other suggestions? Almost every idea discussed until now has at least one person not agreeing with it.
may be we can have ** before and after the word ? Or make the word have a border around every letter(or whole word combined) with a different color if that's possible.
I'll try this and post the screenshots. Thanks for the idea.

Screenshot-from-2020-03-24-02-36-57.png

@Tim Abbott I've given only a border color. Does this work?
That doesn't look good at all, but could be made to work with more effort on the styling.
How about cutout text?
alert-words.png
